newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish Socialist centre attacked, one man hurt.
newsitem.headline: Spanish Socialist centre attacked, one man hurt.

text.p: Hooded attackers threw petrol bombs into a Socialist Party centre in Spain's Basque region on Friday, starting a fire that slightly injured one man, police said.
Several people were inside the party building in the northern Basque town of Hernani, a hotbed of support for the militant Basque separatist group ETA, when the group attacked.
A 48-year-old man was taken to hospital suffering from smoke inhalation, but apparently was not seriously hurt, police said. Firefighters later extinguished the blaze.
The attack follows Thursday's arrests of several members of a violent youth group, one of several that support ETA by attacking official buildings, banks and buses.

Spain's Interior Minister issued a warning earlier in the week that ETA (Basque Homeland and Freedom), which has killed some 800 people in its 28-year drive for Basque independence, would strike in retaliation for recent youth group arrests.
Officials said ETA was responsible for the shooting death of an army officer on Wednesday in Madrid.
